alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; Northern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 6:16PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cook County through 700 PM CDT... At 615 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Des Plaines, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chicago, Cicero, Evanston, Skokie, Des Plaines, Berwyn, Oak Park, Glenview, Park Ridge, Northbrook, Niles, West Town, Austin, Bridgeport, Chicago Loop, South Lawndale, Lake View, Irving Park, West Ridge and Lincoln Park. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 289 and 294. I-90 between mile markers 77 and 84. I-94 between mile markers 32 and 57. I-290 between mile markers 19 and 29. I-294 between mile markers 32 and 57. This includes... Lincoln Park Zoo, Loyola University, Triton College, Northeastern Illinois University, Northwestern University, Soldier Field, University of Illinois Chicago, US Cellular Field...IL Institute of Technology, Wrigley Field, The Loop, Museum Campus, and Northerly Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern Illinois.
